caption.p: Research themes and core concepts identified within key research focussing on ‘Managerial Interpretation’

td.p: An individual’s frames on a situation determines what they pay attention to and in turn their interpretation. E.g. new technology as a threat or opportunity determines their opinion on risk and subsequent search
Advancing or constraining- Frames determine subsequent search
Categorization- Frame determines categorisation. Categorisation reduces ambiguity

tr.td: Interpretation Impacts Decision Managerial interpretations determined choice and degree of sustainability action. Mediating factors may include “responsibility to society and moral legitimacy” (Haney, 2017, p.261)

td.p: Factors from the environmental and organisation as well as the individual shape interpretation

tr.td: Shaped- Interpretations shaped by factors at the individual, organisational and wider environmental level
